(default)
Struct _cef_screen_info_t

   in cef_types.h
struct _cef_screen_info_t

Screen information used when window rendering is disabled. This structure is passed as a parameter to CefRenderHandler::GetScreenInfo and should be filled in by the client.

Field Summary
 cef_rect_t available_rect
          This is set from the rcWork member of MONITORINFOEX, to whit: "A RECT structure that specifies the work area rectangle of the display monitor that can be used by applications, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates. Windows uses this rectangle to maximize an application on the monitor. The rest of the area in rcMonitor contains system windows such as the task bar and side bars. Note that if the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values".
 int depth
          The screen depth in bits per pixel.
 int depth_per_component
          The bits per color component.
 float device_scale_factor
          Device scale factor.
 int is_monochrome
          This can be true for black and white printers.
 cef_rect_t rect
          This is set from the rcMonitor member of MONITORINFOEX, to whit: "A RECT structure that specifies the display monitor rectangle, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates. Note that if the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values." The |rect| and |available_rect| properties are used to determine the available surface for rendering popup views.
 

Field Detail

available_rect

public cef_rect_t available_rect;
This is set from the rcWork member of MONITORINFOEX, to whit: "A RECT structure that specifies the work area rectangle of the display monitor that can be used by applications, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates. Windows uses this rectangle to maximize an application on the monitor. The rest of the area in rcMonitor contains system windows such as the task bar and side bars. Note that if the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values". The |rect| and |available_rect| properties are used to determine the available surface for rendering popup views.

depth

public int depth;
The screen depth in bits per pixel.

depth_per_component

public int depth_per_component;
The bits per color component. This assumes that the colors are balanced equally.

device_scale_factor

public float device_scale_factor;
Device scale factor. Specifies the ratio between physical and logical pixels.

is_monochrome

public int is_monochrome;
This can be true for black and white printers.

rect

public cef_rect_t rect;
This is set from the rcMonitor member of MONITORINFOEX, to whit: "A RECT structure that specifies the display monitor rectangle, expressed in virtual-screen coordinates. Note that if the monitor is not the primary display monitor, some of the rectangle's coordinates may be negative values." The |rect| and |available_rect| properties are used to determine the available surface for rendering popup views.
